intro: Diploglossum auriculatum, commonly known as the auriculate diploglossum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with distinctive auriculate (ear-like) lobes at the base. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
